page.title: 17A WALK AROUND ALRESFORD
page.content: Being a busy rural town, Alresford has many interesting features. Near to the Museum on Pound Hill is a building with 'false' windows, the top row are Georgian but those at each end are painted on! Walking up West St. we pass the Old School House Cafe built in the late 1600s. Further up the St. is the Swan Hotel and opposite the Bell Hotel. Both are old coaching inns dating from before 1552. The Community Centre is Victorian and replaces the Market Hall, now used for clubs, lectures antique fairs etc. Turning into Broad Street we are immediately impressed, there are buildings of interest too numerous to mention, but No.27 is Mitford House birthplace of Mary Russell Mitford. We can walk on down Ladywell lane to the river, Fulling Mill and back.
